# spotted_audiobook (Data Source)



## Example Usage

```terraform
data "spotted_audiobook" "example_audiobook" {
  id = "7iHfbu1YPACw6oZPAFJtqe"
  market = "ES"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `id` (String) The [Spotify ID](/documentation/web-api/concepts/spotify-uris-ids)
for the audiobook.

### Optional

- `market` (String) An [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2).
  If a country code is specified, only content that is available in that market will be returned.<br/>
  If a valid user access token is specified in the request header, the country associated with
  the user account will take priority over this parameter.<br/>
  _**Note**: If neither market or user country are provided, the content is considered unavailable for the client._<br/>
  Users can view the country that is associated with their account in the [account settings](https://www.spotify.com/account/overview/).

### Read-Only

- `authors` (Attributes List) The author(s) for the audiobook. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--authors))
- `available_markets` (List of String) A list of the countries in which the audiobook can be played, identified by their [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code.
- `chapters` (Attributes) The chapters of the audiobook. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--chapters))
- `copyrights` (Attributes List) The copyright statements of the audiobook. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--copyrights))
- `description` (String) A description of the audiobook. HTML tags are stripped away from this field, use `html_description` field in case HTML tags are needed.
- `edition` (String) The edition of the audiobook.
- `explicit` (Boolean) Whether or not the audiobook has explicit content (true = yes it does; false = no it does not OR unknown).
- `external_urls` (Attributes) External URLs for this audiobook. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--external_urls))
- `href` (String) A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the audiobook.
- `html_description` (String) A description of the audiobook. This field may contain HTML tags.
- `images` (Attributes List) The cover art for the audiobook in various sizes, widest first. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--images))
- `languages` (List of String) A list of the languages used in the audiobook, identified by their [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639) code.
- `media_type` (String) The media type of the audiobook.
- `name` (String) The name of the audiobook.
- `narrators` (Attributes List) The narrator(s) for the audiobook. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--narrators))
- `publisher` (String) The publisher of the audiobook.
- `total_chapters` (Number) The number of chapters in this audiobook.
- `type` (String) The object type.
Available values: "audiobook".
- `uri` (String) The [Spotify URI](/documentation/web-api/concepts/spotify-uris-ids) for the audiobook.

<a id="nestedatt--authors"></a>
### Nested Schema for `authors`

Read-Only:

- `name` (String) The name of the author.


<a id="nestedatt--chapters"></a>
### Nested Schema for `chapters`

Read-Only:

- `href` (String) A link to the Web API endpoint returning the full result of the request
- `items` (Attributes List) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--chapters--items))
- `limit` (Number) The maximum number of items in the response (as set in the query or by default).
- `next` (String) URL to the next page of items. ( `null` if none)
- `offset` (Number) The offset of the items returned (as set in the query or by default)
- `previous` (String) URL to the previous page of items. ( `null` if none)
- `total` (Number) The total number of items available to return.

<a id="nestedatt--chapters--items"></a>
### Nested Schema for `chapters.items`

Read-Only:

- `audio_preview_url` (String, Deprecated) A URL to a 30 second preview (MP3 format) of the chapter. `null` if not available.
- `available_markets` (List of String) A list of the countries in which the chapter can be played, identified by their [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) code.
- `chapter_number` (Number) The number of the chapter
- `description` (String) A description of the chapter. HTML tags are stripped away from this field, use `html_description` field in case HTML tags are needed.
- `duration_ms` (Number) The chapter length in milliseconds.
- `explicit` (Boolean) Whether or not the chapter has explicit content (true = yes it does; false = no it does not OR unknown).
- `external_urls` (Attributes) External URLs for this chapter. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--chapters--items--external_urls))
- `href` (String) A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the chapter.
- `html_description` (String) A description of the chapter. This field may contain HTML tags.
- `id` (String) The [Spotify ID](/documentation/web-api/concepts/spotify-uris-ids) for the chapter.
- `images` (Attributes List) The cover art for the chapter in various sizes, widest first. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--chapters--items--images))
- `is_playable` (Boolean) True if the chapter is playable in the given market. Otherwise false.
- `languages` (List of String) A list of the languages used in the chapter, identified by their [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639) code.
- `name` (String) The name of the chapter.
- `release_date` (String) The date the chapter was first released, for example `"1981-12-15"`. Depending on the precision, it might be shown as `"1981"` or `"1981-12"`.
- `release_date_precision` (String) The precision with which `release_date` value is known.
Available values: "year", "month", "day".
- `restrictions` (Attributes) Included in the response when a content restriction is applied. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--chapters--items--restrictions))
- `resume_point` (Attributes) The user's most recent position in the chapter. Set if the supplied access token is a user token and has the scope 'user-read-playback-position'. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--chapters--items--resume_point))
- `type` (String) The object type.
Available values: "episode".
- `uri` (String) The [Spotify URI](/documentation/web-api/concepts/spotify-uris-ids) for the chapter.

<a id="nestedatt--chapters--items--external_urls"></a>
### Nested Schema for `chapters.items.external_urls`

Read-Only:

- `spotify` (String) The [Spotify URL](/documentation/web-api/concepts/spotify-uris-ids) for the object.


<a id="nestedatt--chapters--items--images"></a>
### Nested Schema for `chapters.items.images`

Read-Only:

- `height` (Number) The image height in pixels.
- `url` (String) The source URL of the image.
- `width` (Number) The image width in pixels.


<a id="nestedatt--chapters--items--restrictions"></a>
### Nested Schema for `chapters.items.restrictions`

Read-Only:

- `reason` (String) The reason for the restriction. Supported values:
- `market` - The content item is not available in the given market.
- `product` - The content item is not available for the user's subscription type.
- `explicit` - The content item is explicit and the user's account is set to not play explicit content.
- `payment_required` - Payment is required to play the content item.

Additional reasons may be added in the future.
**Note**: If you use this field, make sure that your application safely handles unknown values.


<a id="nestedatt--chapters--items--resume_point"></a>
### Nested Schema for `chapters.items.resume_point`

Read-Only:

- `fully_played` (Boolean) Whether or not the episode has been fully played by the user.
- `resume_position_ms` (Number) The user's most recent position in the episode in milliseconds.




<a id="nestedatt--copyrights"></a>
### Nested Schema for `copyrights`

Read-Only:

- `text` (String) The copyright text for this content.
- `type` (String) The type of copyright: `C` = the copyright, `P` = the sound recording (performance) copyright.


<a id="nestedatt--external_urls"></a>
### Nested Schema for `external_urls`

Read-Only:

- `spotify` (String) The [Spotify URL](/documentation/web-api/concepts/spotify-uris-ids) for the object.


<a id="nestedatt--images"></a>
### Nested Schema for `images`

Read-Only:

- `height` (Number) The image height in pixels.
- `url` (String) The source URL of the image.
- `width` (Number) The image width in pixels.


<a id="nestedatt--narrators"></a>
### Nested Schema for `narrators`

Read-Only:

- `name` (String) The name of the Narrator.
